verses.verse: My son, <S%H1121><s%> pay attention <S%H7181><s%> to my wisdom. <S%H2451><s%> Turn <S%H5186><s%> your ear <S%H241><s%> to my understanding: <S%H8394><s%>
that you may maintain <S%H8104><s%> discretion, <S%H4209><s%> that your lips <S%H8193><s%> may preserve <S%H5341><s%> knowledge. <S%H1847><s%>
For the lips <S%H8193><s%> of an adulteress <S%H2114><s%> drip <S%H5197><s%> honey. <S%H5317><s%> Her mouth <S%H2441><s%> is smoother <S%H2509><s%> than oil, <S%H8081><s%>
But in the end <S%H319><s%> she is as bitter <S%H4751><s%> as wormwood, <S%H3939><s%> and as sharp <S%H2299><s%> as a two-edged <S%H6310><s%> sword. <S%H2719><s%>
Her feet <S%H7272><s%> go down <S%H3381><s%> to death. <S%H4194><s%> Her steps <S%H6806><s%> lead straight <S%H8551><s%> to Sheol. <S%H7585><s%>
She gives no thought <S%H6424><s%> to the way <S%H4570><s%> of life. <S%H2416><s%> Her ways <S%H4570><s%> are crooked, <S%H5128><s%> and she doesn't <S%H3045><s%> know it.
Now therefore, <S%H1121><s%> my sons, listen <S%H8085><s%> to me. <S%H5493><s%> Don't depart from the words <S%H561><s%> of my mouth. <S%H6310><s%>
Remove <S%H7368><s%> your way <S%H1870><s%> far <S%H7368><s%> from her. <S%H7126><s%> Don't come near the door <S%H6607><s%> of her house, <S%H1004><s%>
lest you give <S%H5414><s%> your honor <S%H1935><s%> to others, <S%H312><s%> and your years <S%H8141><s%> to the cruel one; <S%H394><s%>
lest strangers <S%H2114><s%> feast <S%H7646><s%> on your wealth, <S%H3581><s%> and your labors <S%H6089><s%> enrich another man <S%H5237><s%>'s house. <S%H1004><s%>
You will groan <S%H5098><s%> at your latter <S%H319><s%> end, <S%H1320><s%> when your flesh and your body <S%H1320><s%> are consumed, <S%H3615><s%>
and say, <S%H559><s%> "How I have hated <S%H8130><s%> instruction, <S%H4148><s%> and my heart <S%H3820><s%> despised <S%H5006><s%> reproof; <S%H8433><s%>
neither have I obeyed <S%H8085><s%> the voice <S%H6963><s%> of my teachers, <S%H3384><s%> nor turned <S%H5186><s%> my ear <S%H241><s%> to those who instructed me! <S%H3925><s%>
I have come to the brink <S%H4592><s%> of utter ruin, <S%H7451><s%> in the midst <S%H8432><s%> of the gathered <S%H6951><s%> assembly. <S%H6951><s%>"
Drink <S%H8354><s%> water <S%H4325><s%> out of your own cistern, <S%H953><s%> running water <S%H5140><s%> out of <S%H8432><s%> your own well. <S%H875><s%>
Should your springs <S%H4599><s%> overflow <S%H6327><s%> in the streets, <S%H7339><s%> streams <S%H6388><s%> of water <S%H4325><s%> in the public squares? <S%H7339><s%>
Let them be for yourself alone, <S%H2114><s%> not for strangers with you.
Let your spring <S%H4726><s%> be blessed. <S%H1288><s%> Rejoice <S%H8055><s%> in the wife <S%H802><s%> of your youth. <S%H5271><s%>

A loving <S%H158><s%> doe <S%H365><s%> and a graceful <S%H2580><s%> deer <S%H3280><s%>â€” let her breasts <S%H1717><s%> satisfy <S%H7301><s%> you at all times. <S%H6256><s%> Be captivated <S%H7686><s%> always <S%H8548><s%> with her love. <S%H160><s%>
For why should you, <S%H1121><s%> my son, be captivated <S%H7686><s%> with an adulteress? <S%H2114><s%> Why embrace <S%H2263><s%> the bosom <S%H2436><s%> of another? <S%H5237><s%>
For the ways <S%H1870><s%> of man <S%H376><s%> are before <S%H5227><s%> the eyes <S%H5869><s%> of Yahweh. <S%H3068><s%> He examines <S%H6424><s%> all his paths. <S%H4570><s%>
The evil <S%H5771><s%> deeds of the wicked <S%H7563><s%> ensnare <S%H3920><s%> him. <S%H2256><s%> The cords of his sin <S%H2403><s%> hold him firmly. <S%H8551><s%>
He will die <S%H4191><s%> for lack of instruction. <S%H4148><s%> In the greatness <S%H7230><s%> of his folly, <S%H200><s%> he will go astray. <S%H7686><s%>
